page.title: 16CHANGING TIMES
page.content: A GROUP OF LOCAL PEOPLE WERE INTERVIEWED TO DISCOVER THE DIFFERENCES IN LIFESTYLES BETWEEN THE 1930'S AND THE 1980'S.THESE RESIDENTS MOVED INTO THE AREA IN 1938 WHEN MANY OF THE HOUSES WERE BUILT.IN THOSE DAYS THERE WERE NO GARAGES OR FLATS AND VERY FEW LOCAL SHOPS.NEW RESIDENTS IN 1938 WERE TREATED TO FREE DELIVERY OF GROCERIES. A NEW HOUSE IN 1938 COST BETWEEN 700 AND 900 POUNDS.IN 1985 THE SAME HOUSES COST BETWEEN 65000 AND 90000 POUNDS. DURING THE SECOND WORLD WAR THERE WAS A GERMAN AND ITALIAN PRISONER OF WAR CAMP NEARBY. "WHEN YOU WALKED PAST THE CAMP YOU FELT SO SAD",SAID MRS.TREVAN,A LOCAL PERSON. THE GENERAL FEELING WAS THAT,ALTHOUGH THE AREA HAS CHANGED A LOT PHYSICALLY FROM FIELDS AND TRACKS TO HOUSES AND ROADS,IT IS STILL A VERY PLEASANT PLACE TO LIVE.
